intro: Senecio warnockii, commonly known as the Warnock's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small yellow flowers that are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets. Senecio warnockii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
